meanings.definition: A type of trust in which the trustee is required to pay a fixed percentage of the trust assets to the beneficiaries annually.
meanings.sent1: The unitrusts ensured that the beneficiaries received a set portion of the trust each year.
meanings.sent2: Many families benefit from unitrusts that provide them with regular financial support.
meanings.sent3: The unitrusts decided to throw a party for the beneficiaries every year to celebrate their financial gifts.
meanings.sent4: The unitrusts flowed like a steady stream of financial assistance to those in need.
meanings.sent5: Receiving from unitrusts was like getting a reliable yearly gift from a generous friend.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or managing a unitrust.
meanings.sent1: Her expertise in unitrusts made her the go-to person for setting up new trusts.
meanings.sent2: Unitrusts require careful planning and attention to detail to ensure they benefit the beneficiaries.
meanings.sent3: The unitrusts team had a fun time organizing and overseeing the trust distributions.
meanings.sent4: She juggled multiple unitrusts effortlessly, ensuring each one ran smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Managing unitrusts was like conducting a symphony of financial arrangements.
